newsitem.title: JAPAN: TIFFE Euroyen steady despite stocks, MOF Sakakibara.
newsitem.headline: TIFFE Euroyen steady despite stocks, MOF Sakakibara.

text.p: The key March three-month Euroyen futures contract was steady by late morning trade on Tuesday despite firmness in Tokyo stocks and a fall in the yen after a senior Finance Ministry official's remark, traders said.
The dollar/yen rate rose to over 113 yen in early trade after remarks by Eisuke Sakakibara that there has been no change in the ministry's policy on foreign exchange.
"The March eased a bit after Sakakibara, but persistent short-covering demand pushed it back up," said a trader at an agricultural financial institution.
"As with the U.S. Treasury, (MOF) does not have any intention at all of using foreign exchange rates as an instrument of trade policy," Sakakibara said.
The March also overcame the Tokyo stock market's strength, which is usually a negative factor for the yen debt market.
The key Nikkei 225 share index was up by 190.72 points at 19,895.89 by midday.
The Bank of Japan refrained from its regular money market operation at 0020 GMT, leaving the market with a small 10 billion yen surplus.
